name: Ginataang Manok (Chicken Cooked in Coconut Milk)
author: daplo
summary: This is a Filipino chicken dish flavored with ginger and coconut milk.  Each family has their own version.  This is my mother's version.  It's a rich dish that makes your kitchen smell so wonderful!  Once my family smells the ginger frying and coconut milk simmering, they can't wait for it to be done so they can dig in!  I salt it liberally as the coconut milk tends to hide the salt flavor.
ingredients: 1 (5 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
directions: Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat and stir in the ginger slices
Cook and stir until fragrant and lightly browned
Season chicken with salt and pepper
Place chicken in the same skillet over medium-high heat without crowding
Cook until chicken is lightly brown on all sides
Return the ginger to the skillet and add coconut milk
Bring to a boil, then cover the skillet with the lid tilted to allow steam to escape
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the chicken is  no longer pink at the bone, stirring occasionally, about 30 minutes
Simmer uncovered until spinach is warmed through, 8 to 12 minutes
Season with salt and pepper, as necessary
